original_sentence: Cronin and Weaver (1995) ascribe an acknowledgment alongside authorship and citedness to measures of a researcher’s scholarly performance: a feature that reflects the researcher’s productivity and impact.

citations.citation_content: Cronin and Weaver (1995) ascribe an acknowledgment alongside authorship and citedness to measures of a researcher’s scholarly performance: a feature that reflects the researcher’s productivity and impact.
citations.author: Cronin and Weaver

original_sentence: Giles and Councill (2004) argue that acknowledgments to individuals, in the same way as citations, may be used as a metric to measure an individual’s intellectual contribu-tion to scientific work.

citations.citation_content: Giles and Councill (2004) argue that acknowledgments to individuals, in the same way as citations, may be used as a metric to measure an individual’s intellectual contribu-tion to scientific work.
citations.author: Giles and Councill

original_sentence: Acknowledged universities and corporations reveal interactions and knowl-edge exchange between industry and universities (Chen et al., 2022).

citations.citation_content: Acknowledged universities and corporations reveal interactions and knowl-edge exchange between industry and universities (Chen et al., 2022).
citations.author: Chen et al.

original_sentence: CoNLL-2003 corpus (Sang et al., 2003) is a benchmark dataset for language-independent named entity recognition, i.e., designed to train and evaluate NER models.

citations.citation_content: CoNLL-2003 corpus (Sang et al., 2003) is a benchmark dataset for language-independent named entity recognition, i.e., designed to train and evaluate NER models.
citations.author: Sang et al.

original_sentence: 1. 1 3   Scientometrics  	The present paper is an extended version of the article (Smirnova & Mayr, 2022)2 pre-sented at the 3rd Workshop on Extraction and Evaluation of Knowledge Entities from Sci-entific Documents (EEKE2022).3 Flair, an open-source natural language processing (NLP) framework (Akbik et al., 2019) is used in our study to create a tool for the extraction of acknowledged entities because this library is easily customizable.

citations.citation_content: 1. 1 3   Scientometrics  	The present paper is an extended version of the article (Smirnova & Mayr, 2022)2 pre-sented at the 3rd Workshop on Extraction and Evaluation of Knowledge Entities from Sci-entific Documents (EEKE2022).3 Flair, an open-source natural language processing (NLP) framework (Akbik et al., 2019) is used in our study to create a tool for the extraction of acknowledged entities because this library is easily customizable.
citations.author: Smirnova & Mayr

citations.citation_content: 1. 1 3   Scientometrics  	The present paper is an extended version of the article (Smirnova & Mayr, 2022)2 pre-sented at the 3rd Workshop on Extraction and Evaluation of Knowledge Entities from Sci-entific Documents (EEKE2022).3 Flair, an open-source natural language processing (NLP) framework (Akbik et al., 2019) is used in our study to create a tool for the extraction of acknowledged entities because this library is easily customizable.

original_sentence: The first typology of acknowledgments was proposed by Mackintosh (1972) (as cited in Cronin, 1995) and comprised three categories: facilities, access to data, and help of indi-viduals.

citations.citation_content: The first typology of acknowledgments was proposed by Mackintosh (1972) (as cited in Cronin, 1995) and comprised three categories: facilities, access to data, and help of indi-viduals.
citations.author: as cited in Cronin

original_sentence: McCain (1991) distinguished five types of acknowledgements: research-related information, secondary access to research-related information, specific research-related communication, general peer communication, and technical or clerical support.

citations.citation_content: McCain (1991) distinguished five types of acknowledgements: research-related information, secondary access to research-related information, specific research-related communication, general peer communication, and technical or clerical support.
citations.author: McCain

original_sentence: Cronin and Weaver (1995) defined three broad categories: resource-, procedure- and concept-related.

citations.citation_content: Cronin and Weaver (1995) defined three broad categories: resource-, procedure- and concept-related.
citations.author: Cronin and Weaver

original_sentence: Mejia and Kajikawa (2018) developed a four-level classification based on sponsored research field: change maker, incremental, breakthrough, and matured.

citations.citation_content: Mejia and Kajikawa (2018) developed a four-level classification based on sponsored research field: change maker, incremental, breakthrough, and matured.
citations.author: Mejia and Kajikawa

original_sentence: Doehne and Herfeld (2023) distinguished acknowledgements from the perspective of appreciation of influential scholars and defined two axes: scientific influence and insti-tutional influence.

citations.citation_content: Doehne and Herfeld (2023) distinguished acknowledgements from the perspective of appreciation of influential scholars and defined two axes: scientific influence and insti-tutional influence.
citations.author: Doehne and Herfeld

original_sentence: Wang and Shapira (2011) investigated the connection between research funding and the development of science and technology using acknowledgments from articles from the field of nanotechnology.

citations.citation_content: Wang and Shapira (2011) investigated the connection between research funding and the development of science and technology using acknowledgments from articles from the field of nanotechnology.
citations.author: Wang and Shapira

citations.author: Rose and Georg

original_sentence: Doehne and Herfeld (2023) manually investigated acknowledgement sections of papers, which were published or preprinted in association with the Cowles Foundation between early 1940 and 1970 to trace the influence of the informal social structure and academic leaders on the early acceptance of scientific innovations.

citations.citation_content: Doehne and Herfeld (2023) manually investigated acknowledgement sections of papers, which were published or preprinted in association with the Cowles Foundation between early 1940 and 1970 to trace the influence of the informal social structure and academic leaders on the early acceptance of scientific innovations.

original_sentence: The Flair NLP framework Flair is an open-sourced NLP framework built on PyTorch (Paszke et al., 2019), which is an open-source machine learning library.

citations.citation_content: The Flair NLP framework Flair is an open-sourced NLP framework built on PyTorch (Paszke et al., 2019), which is an open-source machine learning library.
citations.author: Paszke et al.

original_sentence: “The core idea of the framework is to pre-sent a simple, unified interface for conceptually very different types of word and document  embeddings” (Akbik et al., 2019, p. 54).

citations.citation_content: “The core idea of the framework is to pre-sent a simple, unified interface for conceptually very different types of word and document  embeddings” (Akbik et al., 2019, p. 54).
citations.author: Akbik et al.

original_sentence: Flair has three default training algorithms for NER which were used for the first experiment in the present research: a) NER Model with Flair Embeddings (later on Flair Embeddings) (Akbik et al., 2018), b) NER Model with Transformers (later on Transformers) (Schweter & Akbik, 2020), and c)

citations.author: Schweter & Akbik

citations.citation_content: Flair has three default training algorithms for NER which were used for the first experiment in the present research: a) NER Model with Flair Embeddings (later on Flair Embeddings) (Akbik et al., 2018), b) NER Model with Transformers (later on Transformers) (Schweter & Akbik, 2020), and c)

original_sentence: Zero-shot NER with TARS (later on TARS) (Halder et al., 2020) 8.

original_sentence: The Flair Embeddings model uses stacked embeddings, i.e., a combination of contex-tual string embeddings (Akbik et al., 2018) with a static embeddings model.

citations.citation_content: The Flair Embeddings model uses stacked embeddings, i.e., a combination of contex-tual string embeddings (Akbik et al., 2018) with a static embeddings model.
citations.author: Akbik et al.

original_sentence: Stacked embedding is an important Flair feature, as a combination of different embeddings might bring better results than their separate uses (Akbik et al., 2019).

citations.citation_content: Stacked embedding is an important Flair feature, as a combination of different embeddings might bring better results than their separate uses (Akbik et al., 2019).
citations.author: Akbik et al.

original_sentence: The TARS (task-aware representation of sentences) is a transformer-based model, which allows performing training without any training data (zero-shot learning) or with a small dataset (few-short learning) (Halder et al., 2020).

citations.citation_content: The TARS (task-aware representation of sentences) is a transformer-based model, which allows performing training without any training data (zero-shot learning) or with a small dataset (few-short learning) (Halder et al., 2020).
citations.author: Halder et al.

original_sentence: As WoS contains millions of metadata records (Singh et al., 2021), the data chosen for the present study was restricted by year and scientific domain (for the corpora Nos. 1, 2, and 3) or additionally by the affiliation country (for corpus No.4).

citations.author: Singh et al.
